body_html:
The SingleImageRandomDotStereograms does not have a shape function I think that is the issue.

I added a PR #15431 with the shape function added.

NoteSingleImageRandomDotStereograms takes an attribute of output_image_shape which is in the format of [X, Y, C] ([ImageX, ImageY, Channel]).

However, the actual data output is in the format of [ImageY, ImageX, Channel] ([h, w, c]). So by default the output_image_shape has the value of [1024, 768, 1] but the output data will be [768, 1024, 1].

Don't know if we want to change the behavior or not, so I leave the behavior alone for now.
body_text:
The SingleImageRandomDotStereograms does not have a shape function I think that is the issue.
I added a PR #15431 with the shape function added.
NoteSingleImageRandomDotStereograms takes an attribute of output_image_shape which is in the format of [X, Y, C] ([ImageX, ImageY, Channel]).
However, the actual data output is in the format of [ImageY, ImageX, Channel] ([h, w, c]). So by default the output_image_shape has the value of [1024, 768, 1] but the output data will be [768, 1024, 1].
Don't know if we want to change the behavior or not, so I leave the behavior alone for now.
body:
The `SingleImageRandomDotStereograms` does not have a shape function I think that is the issue.

I added a PR #15431 with the shape function added.

Note`SingleImageRandomDotStereograms` takes an attribute of `output_image_shape` which is in the format of `[X, Y, C]` (`[ImageX, ImageY, Channel]`).

However, the actual data output is in the format of `[ImageY, ImageX, Channel]` (`[h, w, c]`). So by default the output_image_shape has the value of [1024, 768, 1] but the output data will be [768, 1024, 1].

Don't know if we want to change the behavior or not, so I leave the behavior alone for now.
